trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy.PackagingProgressEvent"></xref> event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs"></xref> class.
In certain situations and for specific types, multiple packaging progress events occur at the same time.

These logically distinct, but temporally identical, events are combined into a single <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy.PackagingProgressEvent> and `numberCompleted` is more than 1.
For example, when you print, font subsetting is performed every four pages.
Each page must be cached until the subsetting is complete, and then all four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction> events occur at the same time.
The constructor for the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs> sets `action` to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction> and sets `numberCompleted` to 4.
For example, if a package consists of a single four-page document that uses one font and no images or other resources, the sequence of events might occur as shown in the following table.

**The sequence of events for a simple package** AddingDocumentSequence 1 AddingFixedDocument 1 AddingFixedPage 1 AddingFixedPage 1 AddingFixedPage 1 AddingFixedPage 1 FontAdded 1 FixedPageCompleted 4 FixedDocumentCompleted 1 DocumentSequenceCompleted 1 XpsDocumentCommitted 1
The action that the packaging process is currently performing.
The number of simultaneous times that the specified `action` occurred.
Gets a value that indicates what action is currently occurring in the packaging process.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction"></xref> that represents the part of the packaging process that is currently occurring.
Gets the number of simultaneous times that the action that is identified in <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs.Action*> has occurred.
In certain situations and for specific types, multiple packaging progress events occur at the same time.

These logically distinct, but temporally identical, events are combined into a single <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy.PackagingProgressEvent> and NumberCompleted is more than 1.
For example, when you print, font subsetting is performed every four pages.
Each page must be cached until the subsetting is complete, and then all four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction> events occur at the same time.

The resulting <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs> sets <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs.Action%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingAction> and sets NumberCompleted to 4.

For example, if a package consists of a single four-page document that uses one font and no images or other resources, the sequence of events might occur as shown in the following table: **The sequence of events for a simple package** AddingDocumentSequence 1 AddingFixedDocument 1 AddingFixedPage 1 AddingFixedPage 1 AddingFixedPage 1 AddingFixedPage 1 FontAdded 1 FixedPageCompleted 4 FixedDocumentCompleted 1 DocumentSequenceCompleted 1 XpsDocumentCommitted 1
An <xref:System.Int32> that represents the number of simultaneous times that the action that is identified in <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackagingProgressEventArgs.Action*> has occurred.
